passage_text: Ultrasound technician’s salary in the United States is around $65,001 per annum. The annual salary for an ultrasound technician with less than 2 years of clinical experience is about $40,000 while the annual income for those with a bachelors’ degree is up to $65,000. Similarly, about 75th percentile of ultrasound technicians received $71,626, 25th percentile of them received $59,870 while 10th percentile received $54,745 per year. According to US payscale, an ultrasound technician receives an average hourly wage ranging from between $17.61 – $36.24 per hour. In addition, a yearly bonus of about $2,528 will be credited to his or her account

Salaries. Ultrasound techs earned an average $65,800 annually, or $31.63 per hour, as of May 2011, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics. The lowest-paid 10 percent received $44,950 per year, or $21.61 per hour. The highest-paid 10 percent made $90,640 yearly, or $43.58 hourly. In 2011, over 59 percent of the 54,760 ultrasound technicians worked for general medical and surgical hospitals, making them the largest employer of the profession. Techs here made a mean $65,870 per year, or $31.67 per hour.

Ultrasound technician’s salary (shortly known as ultrasound tech salary) in the United States is about $64,900 per year and an average hourly wage is about $31.20 per hour. Similarly, about 75th percentile of ultrasound technicians received $71,626, 25th percentile of them received $59,870 while 10th percentile received $54,745 per year. According to US payscale, an ultrasound technician receives an average hourly wage ranging from between $17.61 – $36.24 per hour. In addition, a yearly bonus of about $2,528 will be credited to his or her account

(United States). An average Ultrasound Technologist in the United States can expect to take home roughly $28.45 per hour. Earnings generally vary between $19.85 per hour and $38.32. Experience level and the particular city each impact pay for this group, with the former having the largest influence.

The state with the most jobs for ultrasound technicians in 2011 was California, with over 9 percent of the positions and mean wages at $81,750 per year, or $39.30 per hour. The city with the same distinction was New York, with average pay of $64,880 annually, or $31.19 per hour. In 2011, over 59 percent of the 54,760 ultrasound technicians worked for general medical and surgical hospitals, making them the largest employer of the profession. Techs here made a mean $65,870 per year, or $31.67 per hour.

Certified ultrasound technician salary. An average hourly wage for a newly certified ultrasound technician in the United States ranges between $13.49 and $33.58 per hour which gradually increases from $13.59 – $58.06 overtime. Similarly, about 75th percentile of ultrasound technicians received $71,626, 25th percentile of them received $59,870 while 10th percentile received $54,745 per year. According to US payscale, an ultrasound technician receives an average hourly wage ranging from between $17.61 – $36.24 per hour. In addition, a yearly bonus of about $2,528 will be credited to his or her account

Salary of ultrasound technicians prevailing in the United States is around $64,900 per year. Average hourly wage is around $31.20. If you are highly experienced and efficient, you can expect more than $88,490 per year. The lowest salary of these healthcare professionals is around $44,900 per year. As per the 10th percentile, ultrasound technician salary ranges from $45,840-$92,070 per year. Very top end technicians can earn six-figure salaries. You are also eligible for getting around $2,528 as bonus. Total earning of ultrasound technician including all benefits ranges from $36,120 – $77,268 per year.

(United States). Most Ultrasound Technicians in the United States are women. The workforce as a whole earns a median of approximately $25.19 per hour. The income range spans the entire spectrum between $14.91 per hour and $35.34
